 More than 3,000 people are killed a year by animals (sharks, snakes, bears, alligators, etc). Should we divert attention from the war on terror to fighting animals?
 
 The war on terror/Iraq shouldn't even be put in the same category as AIDs or deaths attributed to car crashes. AIDs and automobiles deaths are usually caused by someone's negligence (using unsterilized needles, unprotected sex, drunk driving, talking on cell phones while driving, etc). Often people and their stupidity and ignorance are the causes for most of these deaths. Very few of the AIDs and automobile deaths occur not by a drug user or car driver (only kids born with AIDs and maybe car deaths attributed to faulty equipment). They also don't happen in mass killings (9/11 killed 3,000 in one day...I don't know of 1 car crash or 1 needle that killed 3,000).
 
 On the other hand, the war on terror isn't attributed to some negligence on our part. People, mainly Islamofascists, are out there to kill us. AIDs victims generally aren't out there to infect other people. The terrorists goal is to kill us. Me and you can prevent ourselves from getting AIDs and extremely limit our chances of dying in car crashes by using discipline and common sense. We ourselves cannot prevent dying at the hands of a suicide bomber or a nuclear bomb.
 
 People fear terrorism because it is unpredictable and very deadly. People don't fear AIDs or automobile deaths as much because their actions can prevent them. I can choose not to have unprotected sex or use unsterilized needles, but I cannot choose not to be in a building that gets hit by a plane or live in an area that is effected by a nuclear weapon.

 "People in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than governments." 
 
 "The problem in defense is how far you can go without destroying from within what you are trying to defend from without." 
 
 "In most communities it is illegal to cry "fire" in a crowded assembly. Should it not be considered serious international misconduct to manufacture a general war scare in an effort to achieve local political aims?" 
 
 "I hate war as only a soldier who has lived it can, only as one who has seen its brutality, its futility, its stupidity." 
 
 "Whatever America hopes to bring to pass in the world must first come to pass in the heart of America."
 
 "There is no glory in battle worth the blood it costs"
